definitions.title: part. of relation
definitions.body: (Moab. id.; origin dub.:

acc. to Tsepreghi:Diss. Lugd. p. 171 Mühlau:Bö. Lb. ii. 79 n. Sta:Morg. Forsch. 1875, 188; La. § 167 Hommel:ZMG 1878, 708 ff. Müll:§ 153 Sayce:Hbr. ii. 51 Lag:M. i. 255 & esp. Kraetzschmar:Hbr. vi. 298 ff, orig. a subst. ‘ place ’ = 0’a3arun footstep, mark, 0a3ar: (do.), [[אֲתַר]], 0atar place, As. asûru, used (v. Kraetz.) both as a subst. ‘ there, where, ’ and as a relative of place ‘ where ’: in Heb. this development has advanced further, and it has become a relative sign generally. The chief objection to this explanation is that it would isolate Heb. from the other Semitic languages, in which pronouns are formed regularly from demonstrative roots (cf. also Nö:ZMG 1886, 738).

according to Phi:St. C. 73 Sperling:Nota Rel. im Heb 1876, 15–22 for [[אֲשֶׁל]], developed from the relative [[שׁ]] (q.v.) by (1) the prefixing of either a merely prosthetic [[א]], or, better, a pronominal [[א]] (giving rise to [[אש]], the form of the relative in Ph.), and (2) the addition of the demonstr. root [[ל]] [found also in [[אֵל]], [[אֵלָּה]], [[הַלָּזֶה]] (q.v.), 0’al=ad-iy he who, 0la: who (pl.)]: the main objection to this explanation is the change of [[ל]] to [[ר]], which is hardly rendered probable by the comp. of Syr. horko0 by side of Targ. [[הָלְכָּא]].
seems preferable, the primitive root having acquired different significations in the different Semitic languages, and having been weakened in Heb. to a mere particle of relation). A

definitions.title: sign of relation
definitions.body: , bringing the clause introduced by it into relation with an antecedent clause. As a rule [[אֲשֶׁר]] is a mere

definitions.title: connecting link
definitions.body: , and requires to be supplemented (see the grammars) by a pron. affix, or other word, such as [[שָׁם]], defining the nature of the relation more precisely: e.g. Ge 1:11 [[אֲשֶׁר זַרֵעוֹ־בוֹ]] lit. as to which, its seed is in it = in which is its seed, Ps 1:4 like the chaff [[אֲשֶׁר־תִּדְּפֶנּוּ רוּחַ]] as to which, the wind drives it = which the wind drives, etc.; & so [[שָׁם]]…[[אֲשֶׁר]] = where, [[מִשָּׁם]]…[[אֲשֶׁר]] = whence, Ge 2:11, Ge 3:23, Ge 20:13 etc. Sometimes also (v. infr.) the relation expressed by it is specifically temporal, local causal, etc. More particularly

it includes its pronominal antecedent, whether in the nom. or obl. cases, as Nu 22:6 [[וַאֲשֶׁר תָּאׂר יוּאָר]] and he whom thou cursest is cursed, Ex 4:12 and I will teach thee [[אֲשֶׁר תְּדַבֵּר]] that which thou shalt say; and with particles or prepositions, as [[אֵת אֲשֶׁר]] (acc. to the context) him who…, those who…, that which…; [[לַאֲשֶׁר]] to him who… Ge 43:16, to those who… Ge 47:24, to that which Ge 27:8; [[מֵאֲשֶׁר]] Ju Jdg 16:30, 2Sa 18:18 than those whom; Le 27:24 [[לַאֲשֶׁר]] [[קָנׇהוּ מֵאִתּוֹ]] to him from whom he bought it, Nu 5:7; Is 24:2 [[כַּאֲשֶׁר נשֶׁא בוֹ]] like him against whom there is a creditor.

instances of [[אֲשֶׁר]] followed by a pron. affix, or by [[שָׁם]], [[שָֽׁמָּה]], [[מִשָּׁם]], are so common that the exx. cited above will be sufficient. Very rarely there occurs the anomalous constr. [[עִם אֲשֶׁר]] Ge 31:32 for [[אֲשֶׁר עִמּוֹ]] (see Ge 44:9), [[בַּאֲשֶׁר]] Is 47:12 for [[אֲשֶׁר בָּהֶם]], [[לַאֲשֶׁר]] for [[לָהֶם]]…[[אֲשֶׁר]] Ez Eze 23:40: Ps 119:49 see under [[על אשׁר]]. It is followed by the pron. in the nomin., in the foll. cases:—(a) immediately, mostly before an adj. or ptcp., Ge 9:3 all moving things [[אֲשֶׁר הוּא־חַי]] which are living, Le 11:26, Nu 9:13, Nu 14:8, Nu 14:27, Nu 35:31, De 20:20, 1Sa 10:19 (v. Dr) 2Ki 25:19 (‖ Je 52:25 [[היה]]) Je 27:9, Ez Eze 43:19, Hag 1:9, Ru 4:15, Ne 2:18, Ec 7:26; before a vb. 2Ki 22:13 (omitted 2Ch 34:21). (b) in a negative sentence, at the end: Ge 7:2, Ge 17:12, Nu 17:5, De 17:15 [[אֲשֶׁר לאׁ אָחִיךָ הוּא]] who is not thy brother, De 20:15, Ju Jdg 19:12, 1Ki 8:41 ‖ 1Ki 9:20 ‖. N.B. Ps 16:3 [[אֲשֶׁר בָּאָרֶץ הֵָמָּה]] is an unparalleled expression for ‘ who are in the land ’; rd. ´[[אֲשֶׁר בָּאָָרֶץ הֵמָּה אַדִּירֵי וג]] ‘ the saints that are in the land, they ([[המה]]) are the nobles, in whom, ’ etc.

sometimes (though rarely) the defining adjunct is a pron. of 1 or 2 ps. as well as of 3 ps. In such cases it is strictly to be rendered I who…, thou who, etc.; Ho 14:4 [[אֲשֶׁר־בְּךָ יְרֻחַם יׇתוֹם]] thou by whom the fatherless is compassionated ! Je 31:32 I, whose covenant they brake, Je 32:19, Is 49:23, Job 37:17 f. thou whose garments are warm…, canst thou ? etc., Ps 71:19, Ps 71:20, Ps 144:12 we whose sons, etc., Ps 139:15 my frame was not hidden from thee, [[אֲשֶׁר־עֻשֵּׂיתִי בַסֵּתֶר]]—I who was wrought in secret (= though I was wrought in secret), Ex 14:13 for ye who have seen the Egyptians to-day,—ye shall not see them again for ever! (cf. Ps 41:9).
the defining pron. adjunct is dispensed with—

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: when [[אֲשֶׁר]] represents the simple subj. of a sentence, or the direct obj. of a vb.: so constantly, as Ge 2:1 the work [[אֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה]] which he made, Ge 3:3 the tree [[אֲשֶׁר בְּתוֹךְ הַגׇּן]] which is in the midst of the garden, etc.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: after words denoting time, place, or manner, so that [[אֲשֶׁר]] then becomes equivalent to when, where, why: (a) Ge 6:4 [[אַחֲרֵי כֵן אֲשֶׁר]] afterwards, when, etc. (cf. 2Ch 35:20) Ge 45:6 there are still 5 years [[אֲשֶׁר אֵין חָרִישׁ]] when there shall be no plowing, Jos 14:10, 1Ki 22:25; after [[יוֹם]] or [[הַיּוֹם]] De 4:10, Ju Jdg 4:14, 1Sa 24:5 (v. Dr) 2Sa 19:25, Je 20:14 al.; similarly Ge 40:13. (b) Ge 35:13 [[בַּמָּקוֹם אֲשֶׁר דִּבֶּר אִתּוֹ]] in the place where he spake with him, v:Ge 35:14, Ge 39:20, Nu 13:27, Nu 22:26, De 1:31 in the desert which thou sawest, where (accents Ke Di), De 8:15, 1Ki 8:9 (unless [[לוּחוֹת הַבְּרִית]] has here fallen out: v. LXX & De 9:9) Is 55:11 Is 64:10 Ps 84:4. So (g) in [[אֶל אֲשֶׁר]] to (the place) which (or whither) Ex 32:34, Ru 1:16; [[אֶל־כָּל־אֲשֶׁר]] to every (place) whither Jos 1:16, Pr 17:8; [[בַּאֲשֶׁר]] in (the place) where † Ju Jdg 5:27, Jdg 17:8, Jdg 17:9, 1Sa 23:13, 2Ki 8:1, Ru 1:16, Ru 1:17, Job 39:30, once only with [[שָׁם]] Ge 21:17; [[בְּכׂל אֲשֶׁר]] wheresoever Jos 1:7, Jos 1:9, Ju Jdg 2:15, 1Sa 14:47, 1Sa 18:5, 2Sa 7:7, 2Ki 18:7; [[מֵאֲשֶׁר]] from (the place) where = whencesoever † Ex 5:11, Ru 2:9; [[עַל־אֲשֶׁר]] to (the place) whither (or which) 2Sa 15:20, 1Ki 18:12; [[עַל־כָּל־אֲשֶׁר]] Je 1:7. (d) …[[זֶה הַדָּבָר אֲשֶׁר]] this is the reason that or why… Jos 5:4, 1Ki 11:27.

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: more extreme instances Le 14:22, Le 14:30, Le 14:31, Nu 6:21, De 7:19 (wherewith), De 28:20, 1Sa 2:32 (wherein), 1Ki 2:26, Ju Jdg 8:15 (about whom), Is 8:12 (where [[יאמר]] would be foll. normally by [[לוֹ]]), Is 31:6 turn ye to (him as to) whom they have deeply rebelled, Is 47:15, Zep 3:11, Ec 3:9, 1Ki 14:19 (= how).

definitions.title: d.
definitions.body: it is dispensed with only in appearance after (´[[אָמַרְתִּי וג]])[[אֲשֶׁר אָמַר ]] followed by the words used, its place being really taken by a pron. in the speech which follows, as Ge 3:17 the tree as to which I commanded thee saying, Thou shalt not eat from it, Ex 22:8, De 28:68, Ju Jdg 7:4 ([[זֶה]]) Jdg 8:15 (where the noun repeated takes the place of the pron., cf. De 9:2) 1Sa 9:17 ([[זֶה]]):23 +; cf. 2Sa 11:16, 2Ki 17:12, 2Ki 21:4.
[[אֲשֶׁר]] sts. in poet. = one who, a man who (men who), o(/stiv, oi(/tinev, Ps 24:4, Ps 55:20, Ps 95:4, Ps 95:5, Job 4:19, Job 5:5, Job 9:5 (Hi) Job 15:17.

[[אֲשֶׁר]] occas. receives its closer definition by a subst. following it, in other words, its logical antecedent is inserted in the rel. clause: (a) in the phrase peculiar to Je., ´[[אֶל יר]] ´[[אֲשֶׁר הָיׇה דְבַר י]] that which came (of) the word of ´[[י]] to Je. † Je 14:1, Je 46:1, Je 47:1, Je 49:34 (cf. Ew:§ 334); (b) Ex 25:9, Nu 33:4, 1Sa 25:30, 2Ki 8:12, 2Ki 12:6 [[לְכׂל]] :[[אֲשֶׁר־יִמָּחֵא שָׁם בָּֽדֶק]] Ez Eze 12:25; cf. the Eth. usage Di:§ 201; (c) (antec. repeated) Ge 49:30 = Ge 50:13, 1Sa 25:30 (´[[י]] repeated), Is 54:9 (prob.) as to which I sware that, etc., Am 5:1 which I take up over you (as) a dirge.
´[[אֲשֶׁר ל]] that (belongs, belong, belonged) to, is used

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: either alone or preceded by [[כָּל־]] to express (all) that (belongs) to, as Ge 14:23 [[מִכָּל־אֲשֶׁר־לְךָ]] of all that is thine, Ge 31:1 [[מֵאֲשֶׁר]] [[לְאָבִינוּ]] of that which was our father's, Ge 32:24 & sent over [[אֶת־אֲשֶׁר־לוֹ]] that which he had, + oft.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: as a circumlocution of the genitive, as Ge 29:9 [[עִם־הַצּאׁן אֲשֶׁר לְאָבִיהָ]] with the sheep that were her father's, Ge 40:5, Ge 47:4, Le 9:8, Ju Jdg 6:11, 1Sa 25:7 [[הָרׂעִים]] [[אֲשֶׁר־לְךָ]], 2Sa 14:31 [[אֶת־הַחֶלְקָה אֲשֶׁר־לִי]], 2Sa 23:8, 1Ki 1:8, 1Ki 1:33 [[עַל הַפִּרְדָּה אֲשֶׁר־לִי]] upon mine own mule, v:1Ki 1:49, 1Ki 4:2, 2Ki 11:10, 2Ki 16:13, Ru 2:21; and esp. in the case of a compound expression depending on a single genit., as Ge 23:9, Ge 40:5, Ge 41:43 [[מִרְכֶּבֶת הַמִּשְׁנֶה אֲשֶׁר־לוֹ]] the chariot of the second rank which he had, Ex 38:30, Ju Jdg 3:20, Jdg 6:25, 1Sa 17:40, 1Sa 21:8 [[אֲבִיר הָרׂעִים אֲשֶׁר]] [[לְשָׁאוּל]] the mightiest of Saul's herdmen, 1Sa 24:5 [[אֶת־כְּנַף־הַמְּעִיל אֲשֶׁר־לְשָׁאוּל]], 2Sa 2:8 Saul's captain of the host, 1Ki 10:28, 1Ki 15:20, 1Ki 22:31, Je 52:17, Ru 4:3.

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: with names of places (esp. such as do not readily admit the st. cstr.) Ju Jdg 18:28, Jdg 19:14 [[הַגִּבְעָה אֲשֶׁר לְבִנְיׇמִין]] Gibeah (the hill) of Benjamin, Jdg 20:4, 1Sa 17:1, 1Ki 15:27, 1Ki 16:15, 1Ki 17:9, 1Ki 19:3, 2Ki 14:11. Comp. [[שֶׁל]] (q.v.) which in Rabb., like the Aram. -[[דִּיל]], diyl, is in habitual use as a mark of the genitive.—N.B. In Aram. also [[דּי]], d, without [[ל]], expresses the gen. relation, as [[מִלְּתָא דִי־מַלְכָּא]], lit. the word, that of the king = the word of the king. The few apparent cases of a similar use of [[אשׁר]] are, however, too foreign to the general usage of the language to be regarded otherwise than as due to textual error: 1Sa 13:8 read [[אֲשֶׁר אָמַר]] (or [[שָׂם]] Ex 19:5) [[שְׁמוּאֵל]] (LXX ei)=pe); 1Ki 11:25 supply [[עָשָׂה]] (LXX h(/n e)poi/hsen); 2Ki 25:10 supply [[אֵת]] with (as ‖ Je 52:14); 2Ch 34:22 read [[וַאֲשֶׁר אָמַר הַמֶּלֶךְ]] (cf. LXX) and those whom the king appointed (abbreviated from 2Ki 22:14); cf. Ew:§ 292 a, b with note.
[[אֲשֶׁר]] becomes, like Aram. [[דּי]], d, a

definitions.title: conj.
definitions.body: approximating in usage to [[כִּי]]: thus

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: = quod, o(/ti, that, subordinating an entire sentence to a verb of knowing, remembering, etc. (a) with [[אֵת]] De 9:7 forget not [[אֵת אֲשֶׁר הִקְחַפְתָּ]] the fact that (= how) thou provokedst, etc., De 29:15, Jos 2:10, 1Sa 24:11, 1Sa 24:19, 2Sa 11:20 know ye not [[אֵת אֲשֶׁר־יׁרוּ]] how they shoot from off the wall ? 2Ki 8:12, Is 38:3 + oft. As subj. (rare) 1Ki 14:19, 2Ki 14:15, 2Ki 20:20. Of time (peculiarly) † 2Sa 14:15 [[עַתָּה אֲשֶׁר]] now (is it) that… Zec 8:20 (prob.) yet (shall it be) that… v:Zec 8:23; cf. [[כִּמְעַט שֶׁ]] Ct So 3:4. (b) without [[אֵת]] (not very common, [[כִּי]] being usually employed): after [[יׇדַע]] Ex 11:7, Ez Eze 20:26 (very strange in Ez: v. Hi) Job 9:5 (Ew De Di) Ec 8:12, [[רָאָה]] De 1:31 (RV) 1Sa 18:15, [[הִתְוַדָּה]] to confess Le 5:5, Le 26:40 b, [[הִשְׁבִּיעַ]] 1Ki 22:16 (caused to swear that…); after a noun Is 38:7 [[הָאוֹת אֲשֶׁר]] the sign that… (‖ 2Ki 20:9 [[כִּי]]): with growing frequency in late Hebrew, 2Ch 2:7, and esp. Ne Est: Ne 2:5, Ne 2:10, Ne 7:65 (= Ezr 2:63) Ne 8:14, Ne 8:15, Ne 10:31, Ne 13:1, Ne 13:19, Ne 13:22, Es 1:19, Es 2:10, Es 3:4, Es 4:11, Es 6:2, Es 8:11, Ec 3:22 ([[מֵאֲשֶׁר]]) Ec 5:4, Ec 7:18 (with [[טוֹב]]: contrast Ru 2:22) v:Ec 7:22; v:Ec 7:29, Ec 8:12, Ec 8:14, Ec 9:1, Da 1:8, Da 1:8. (g) prefixed to a direct citation, like [[כִּי]] q.v. (= o(/ti recitativum) (rare) 1Sa 15:20, 2Sa 1:4, 2Sa 2:4 (v. Dr) Ps 10:6 (prob.), Ne 4:6.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: it is resolvable into so that: Ge 11:7 [[אֲשֶׁר לאׁ יִשְׁמְעוּ]] so that they understand not, etc., Ge 13:16, Ge 22:14 [[אֲשֶׁר יֵאָמֵר]] so that it is said, Ex 20:26, De 4:10, De 4:40 [[אֲשֶׁר יִיטַב לְךָ]] De 6:3, De 28:27, De 28:51, 1Ki 3:12, 1Ki 3:13, 2Ki 9:37, Mal 3:19.

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: it has a causal force, forasmuch as, in that, since: Ge 30:18, Ge 31:49 and Mizpah, [[אֲשֶׁר אָמַר]] for that he said, Ge 34:13, Ge 34:27, Ge 42:21 we are guilty, [[אֲשֶׁר רָאִינוּ]] we who saw (or, in that we saw), Nu 20:13 Meribah, because they strove there, De 3:24, Jos 4:7, Jos 4:23, Jos 22:31, Ju Jdg 9:17, 1Sa 2:23, 1Sa 15:15, 1Sa 20:42 go in peace, [[אֲשֶׁר נִשְׁבַּעְנוּ]] forasmuch as we have sworn, 1Sa 25:26 thou whom (= or, seeing that) ´[[י]] hath withholden, 2Sa 2:5 blessed are ye of ´[[י]], [[אֲשֶׁר עֲשִׂיתֶם]], who (oi(/tinev) have done (or in that ye have done), 1Ki 3:19, 1Ki 15:5, 2Ki 12:3, 2Ki 17:4, 2Ki 23:26, Je 16:13, Ec 8:11, Ec 8:12 (Hi De Now). Here also belongs its use in [[אֲשֶׁר לָמָּה]] since why…? (= lest) Da 1:10: v. sub [[לָמָּה]]. On [[אֲשֶׁר עַל כֵּן]] forasmuch as Job 34:27 v. sub [[כִּי עַל כֵּן]].

definitions.title: d.
definitions.body: it expresses a condition (rare & peculiar): Le 4:22 [[אֲשֶׁר נׇשִׂיא יֶחֱטָא]] in (case) that = when (or if) a ruler sinneth (v:Le 4:3; v:Le 4:13; v:Le 4:27 [[אִם]]), Nu 5:29 (explained differently by Ew:§ 334 a), De 11:27 and the blessing [[אֲשֶׁר תִּשְׁמְעוּ]] if ye hearken (v:De 11:28 [[אִם]]), De 18:22 Ges, Jos 4:21 …[[אֲשֶׁר יִשְׁאָלוּן]] when they ask…, then…(v:Jos 4:6 [[כִּי]]), Is 31:4. In 1Ki 8:33 (‖ 2Ch 6:24 [[כִּי]], cf. K v:2Ch 6:35; v:2Ch 6:37) [[אֲשֶׁר]] may be rendered indifferently because or when. Once, similarly, [[אֵת אֲשֶׁר]] 1Ki 8:31 (‖[[אִם]]).

definitions.title: e.
definitions.body: perh. (exceptionally) = [[כַּאֲשֶׁר]], as, Je 33:22, Is 54:9 (sq. [[כֵּן]]; but [[כֵּן]] q.v. sts. stands without [[כאשׁר]], & [[אשׁר]] may in these passages connect with what precedes); acc. to some also Je 48:8, Ps 106:34 (in a connexion where [[כַּאֲשֶׁר]] would be more usual: [[אֲשֶׁר]] may however be the obj. of [[אָמַר]]). In 1Sa 16:7 [[אֲשֶׁר יִרְאֶה]] [[הָאָדָם]] rd. [[כַּאֲשֶׁר]], v. Dr.

definitions.title: f.
definitions.body: combined with preps., [[אֲשֶׁר]] converts them into conjunctions: see below, [[בַּאֲשֶׁר]], [[כַּאֲשֶׁר]], [[מֵאֲשֶׁר]]. On its use similarly with [[אַחַר]] ([[אַחֲרֵי]]), [[מִבְּלִי]], [[בַּעֲבוּר]], [[עַל דְּבַר]], [[יַעַן]], [[לְמַעַן]], [[כְּפִי]], [[עַד]], [[עַל]], [[עֵקֶב]], [[מִפְּנֵי]], [[תַּחַת]], see these words.—[[הַאֲשֶׁר]], with [[ה]] interrog., occurs once, 2Ki 6:22.

definitions.title: Def
definitions.body: Note I. [[אֲשֶׁר]] being a connecting link, without any perfectly corresponding equivalent in Engl., its force is not unfreq. capable of being represented in more than one way. See e.g. 2Sa 2:5 (above

definitions.title: 8 c
definitions.body: ), Is 28:12 unto whom he said, or for that he said to them.

definitions.title: Def
definitions.body: Note 2. The opinion that [[אֲשֶׁר]] has an asseverative force (like [[כִּי]], q.v.), or introduces the apodosis, is not prob., being both alien to its general usage & not required by the passages alleged. Render Is 8:20 either ‘ Surely acc. to this word will those speak who have no dawn, ’ or ‘…will they speak when (cf. supr.

definitions.title: 8 d
definitions.body: De 11:27, Jos 4:21) they have no dawn. ’
